content.user_title: Guide Spec-Kit + Claude Code Development Workflow
content.value_statement: Developers struggle to maintain consistency between specifications and implementations across multi-folder repositories. This skill provides a structured framework for specification-driven development that integrates seamlessly with Claude Code assistance.
actual_capabilities: Define repository-wide guidelines using multi-folder CLAUDE.md files
Create standardized specification templates and validation rules
Guide Claude Code to align implementations with specification requirements
Establish iteration cycles for specification and prompt refinement
Maintain traceability between specifications and code artifacts
Implement quality assurance frameworks for specs and implementations
limitations: This is a conceptual guidance skill without executable code
Requires existing repository structure to be effective
Does not generate code or modify files automatically
Team commitment to specification-driven approach required

use_cases.title: Establish Project Standards
use_cases.description: Define consistent development patterns and specification formats across multi-folder repositories

use_cases.title: Improve Code Quality
use_cases.description: Ensure implementations trace back to clear specifications with proper validation checkpoints

use_cases.title: Enhance Claude Code Context
use_cases.description: Provide Claude Code with structured specifications to improve code generation accuracy

prompt_templates.title: Set Up Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Spec-Kit workflow skill to establish CLAUDE.md files in the root and subfolders of my project. Create guidelines for specification-driven development.

prompt_templates.title: Create Specification
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through creating a feature specification using Spec-Kit templates. Include success criteria and validation rules.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the Spec-Kit workflow, validate that my implementation matches the specification requirements. Identify gaps and missing test cases.

prompt_templates.title: Refine Process
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze our current Spec-Kit workflow. Suggest improvements to our specification templates and Claude Code integration patterns.

output_examples.input: Set up Spec-Kit workflow for my new project
output: Root CLAUDE.md created with project-wide guidelines
Folder-specific CLAUDE.md files configured for each module
Specification templates added to specs directory
Validation rules established for specification quality

output_examples.input: Create a feature specification for user authentication
output: Feature specification template filled with user stories
Success criteria defined with measurable acceptance tests
Technical requirements documented with API contracts
Validation rules added for implementation verification
Traceability matrix created between specs and code

best_practices: Create specifications before implementation to establish clear success criteria
Use multi-folder CLAUDE.md files to enable inheritance while allowing folder-specific overrides
Maintain bidirectional traceability between specifications and code changes
anti_patterns: Skipping specification creation and starting with code immediately
Creating specifications without testable acceptance criteria
Ignoring specification changes during active implementation phases

faq.question: What is Spec-Kit?
faq.answer: Spec-Kit is a framework for specification-driven development that structures how you document and validate project requirements.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance only. You apply the recommendations manually or use them to guide Claude Code.

faq.question: What CLAUDE.md files do I need?
faq.answer: Create a root CLAUDE.md for project-wide rules and optionally add folder-specific files for module-level conventions.

faq.question: How do I measure specification quality?
faq.answer: Check that specifications are complete, testable, implementable, and include clear success criteria and acceptance tests.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, analyze your current structure first, then introduce Spec-Kit incrementally starting with new features.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional agile?
faq.answer: It complements agile by providing more rigorous specification discipline while maintaining iterative development cycles.
